subject: M6: VERIFY - CLI arguments and help match Node.js
description:
Verify CLI behavior matches Node.js exactly.

**Help comparison:**
```bash
diff <(node bin/cc-query.js --help) <(./zig/zig-out/bin/ccq --help)
# Should show no differences
```

**Argument tests:**
```bash
# Help flags
./zig-out/bin/ccq --help
./zig-out/bin/ccq -h

# Session filter
./zig-out/bin/ccq -s abc123 -d ../test/fixtures
./zig-out/bin/ccq --session abc123 -d ../test/fixtures

# Data directory
./zig-out/bin/ccq -d ../test/fixtures
./zig-out/bin/ccq --data-dir ../test/fixtures

# Project path (if ~/.claude/projects exists)
./zig-out/bin/ccq .

# Error cases
./zig-out/bin/ccq -s  # Should error: missing argument
./zig-out/bin/ccq --unknown  # Should error: unknown option
./zig-out/bin/ccq -d /nonexistent  # Should error: no files
```

**Checklist:**
- [ ] `--help` output identical to Node
- [ ] All flag variants work
- [ ] Error messages match Node
- [ ] Exit codes correct (0 success, 1 error)

**Gate:** Do not proceed to M7 until this passes.
